title: Logoff Group
author: fabio-oliveira-efeo
body_snippet: Possibility to log off in group

comments.snippet: This will not be possible for some protocols (e.i. RDP)
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet: If it is not possible, why does it work in Remote Desktop Connection Manager?
comments.author: fabio-oliveira-efeo

comments.snippet: It is either only disconnecting (not logging the user off) or your local machine is on the same domain as the remote machine. To my knowledge, there is no native way to log a user off of a remote machine that is on a different domain than your local machine.
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet:
It doesn't look like there is a way within the remote desktop library to trigger a logoff directly. However, there may be some other unmanaged code that we can call: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/api/wtsapi32/nf-wtsapi32-wtslogoffsession

I found some instances of this not being a viable solution since some remote systems don't return sessions information properly. But It's work investigating..
comments.author: kmscode

comments.snippet: any progress with this request? I am interested in this one too.
comments.author: sg7280

comments.snippet: Also very interested in logoff and logoff group features.
comments.author: unconfused

comments.snippet: RD Tabs supports this I believe so it should be possible: https://www.avianwaves.com/Software/Tools/RD-Tabs
comments.author: JustinGrote

comments.snippet: Here's another vote for adding this feature.  Works great in RDCMan 2.7.
comments.author: chriskoch99

comments.snippet:
I believe RDM uses a script or send keys to log off. Carefully watch the left bottom of the screen when signing off in RDM.
It opens RUN -> then a CMD window and it logs off.
comments.author: Cyclone47

comments.snippet: Also showing interest in this feature - trying to find something better than RDCM but having the ability to easily logoff is really nice.
comments.author: ry8s

comments.snippet:
This please.
Or allow external tools to be run on all sub-items in a group (then we can write a logoff cmd)
comments.author: xercesbluebutterfly

comments.snippet:
> This will not be possible for some protocols (e.i. RDP)  (@sparerd) 

I wrote an External Tool to logoff from a server (see below) - it's not pretty, and I have only tested on Win Server 2012r2 and 2016 while logged in as admin, via RDP, but it DOES seem to work.

It looks like v1.77 will have "Run External Tools on Folder" (#1336  - though this was completed in 2019 and we are still waiting...) 

With these 2 things in place we have an effective workaround for this request!

Filename:...
comments.author: xercesbluebutterfly
